intro: Tupistra delavayi, commonly known as the Delavay's spurge, is a perennial flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Asia. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, clustered yellow flowers that bloom in late spring or early summer. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun to partial shade. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in certain environments.
